timeline.bodyText:
Shall we acquire the semaphore with the finite timeout?
If the subsequent process failed or crashed, the ballerina thread blocks infinitely.
Use tryAcquire(xx, TimeUnit.SECONDS) with a sufficient timeout period.

timeline.bodyText: Why do we need to set null here? Can we set necessary return value in Kafka actions level?
timeline.author: wggihan

replies.author: ThisaruGuruge

replies.bodyText: Yeah, this is not a Kafka specific thing. If you do not set return value properly, return values of previous nonblocking external calls within the same Strand will exist. This is a kind of a cleanup to avoid unintended results.
replies.author: vinok88

replies.bodyText: Then why we faced this issue now. All these days we didn't face this issue without this?
replies.author: wggihan

replies.bodyText: You won't get this if you set return values in each and every return points from java side (even if you are returning null). We enforce it here by setting it in the constructor itself.
replies.author: vinok88

replies.bodyText: We do not have any Runtime here, since this method is called from Kafka APIs. Therefore we have to store the runtime, when we have the access, and use it this way.

timeline.bodyText: Normally 'isKey' kind word use for a method name.  Shall we use something else like keyPresent  etc.?
timeline.author: wggihan

replies.bodyText:
This is the convention used in Kafka Serializers / Deserializers. Shall we keep it this way ?
Adding to that, in this case, isKey makes more sense, since this is used to determine whether we are configuring the keySerializer or valueSerializer. This value is sent by Kafka Client APIs, when initializing the Serializer / Deserializer. Since they use the same interface for KeySerializer and ValueSerializer, they use this variable to differentiate the two.
replies.author: ThisaruGuruge
